main event: A witness observed a bright, fast-moving solid object in the sky over Summerset, Pennsylvania on July 2-12, 1965.
interesting points: The object was observed for about 30 minutes, with the witness able to track its movement using a watch.
The object was described as very bright, moving very fast, and changing direction sharply.
The witness estimated the object's speed to be between 200-300 miles per hour.
The witness reported seeing the object move from east to west across the sky.
The witness requested a letter from the U.S. government advising them of the findings regarding the sighting.
sighted object: a bright, fast-moving solid object in the sky
